group_1.textLeft: *Pant*... *Pant*...
Okay, that's it for today's training!

group_1.textRight: What... But...

group_1.textLeft: It's no good doing anything when your mind@is in doubt.

group_1.textRight: ...I suppose so...

group_1.textLeft: Hikaru, you don't look too happy either.

group_1.textRight: ...True.

group_1.textLeft: ...Let's talk a little, shall we?

group_1.textRight: Pardon?

group_1.textLeft: There's something you'd like to talk about, isn't@there?

group_1.textRight: ...So you noticed.

group_1.textLeft: So, what are you two worried about?

group_1.textRight: For me, I just saw Yuna-san being distressed...
Somehow, that made Hikaru feel sad, too.

group_1.textLeft: Well, you're very kind... What about you, Yuna?

group_1.textRight: Well...a lot has happened, and I haven't been able@to sort it out yet.

group_1.textLeft: Try to tell me how you feel. It doesn't have to@be coherent.

group_1.textRight: Regarding Juri Ooba...@Was that really a good move...?

group_1.textLeft: Mhm?

group_1.textRight: Even though we had said it was for a peaceful@resolution, in the end, we used force to triumph.
And even that was done in a way that couldn't@be called a fair one, either.
...So, I'm sure she's...likely unsatisfied.

group_1.textLeft: ...That might be true. So then?

group_1.textRight: The truth is... It was like that when I became the@Student Council President, too.
Back then, I had to forcefully suppress those who@opposed me.

group_1.textLeft: ...How do you mean?

group_1.textRight: I made a wish to Kyubey...
And twisted the feelings of the adults who@opposed me.
In the end, I used force to...
That's not true, Yuna-san!

group_1.textLeft: But...
As to why you're the Student Council President@when you're only a first-year...
I've wondered about it for a while now, but I guess@your wish was involved after all.
If you don't mind, could you tell me about that@period of time?

group_1.textRight: ...Certainly.

group_1.narration: My father was the city mayor.@Hoping I could follow in his footsteps with pursuing politics,@father encouraged me to enroll in a prep school.
But...@At the time, I hated his outwardly-friendly appearances,@and the way he would go out to dine with adults@day after day.
In defiance of my father, I deliberately@opted to enroll in a school below my level...

group_1.textCenter: We will now begin the school assembly.

group_1.textLeft: Ugh, so annoyin'. Can't wait for it to be over.

group_1.textRight: Hey! What's with that hair color?!

group_1.textLeft: [chara:800302:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...?!
Huh? Man, how long are you gonna keep harping@on that?

group_1.narration: As soon as I entered the school,@I found myself fed up with the school climate,@which was far rougher than I had imagined...
There were times when I wished@I had followed my father's advice and@gone to an advanced school...
But then, a turning point came for me...

group_1.textLeft: How many times have I asked you to darken@your hair?

group_1.textRight: I told you already, this is my natural hair!

group_1.textLeft: Rules are rules! Go dye it black this week!

group_1.textRight: You should've just been like, "How about I wear@a wig?"

group_1.textLeft: That'd just end up pissing him off even more...

group_1.textRight: ...Is everything alright?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, Kureha-san...

group_1.textRight: Forgive me for asking, but... Is that really your@natural hair?

group_1.textLeft: Really. My hair color is light to begin with...
And I can't even dye it black either, because I've@got allergies...

group_1.textRight: Hey, how about we all go protest to the teachers...?
If enough of us get together and speak up, I'm@sure that teacher won't be able to ignore us.

group_1.textCenter: ...If it's an allergy, I guess it can't be helped.@Bring a medical certificate and I'll let you go.

group_1.textLeft: ...Thank goodness.

group_1.textRight: Thank you very much.

group_1.textLeft: Aren't these school rules kinda wack anyway?@Making students dye their natural hair and stuff.
Like I said, rules are rules.
School rules aren't so easy to change, you know.
...Oh, well, if one of you got to be the Student@Council President,
and had the power to change the whole school?@That'd be a different story.

group_1.textRight: Ugh, he's such a pain in the ass!

group_1.textLeft: Hey, Kureha-san! How about you become the@Student Council President?

group_1.textRight: Exactly! We're too dumb for that.
But you? You're smart, Kureha!

group_1.textLeft: Well, whether it's going to be me or not,
it might be in our best interests if someone can@become the Student Council President
and make changes to the school rules.
This incident today has confirmed one thing to me.
Getting other people involved and talking to the@teachers does get things done sometimes.
Because your words have more power when@you're not on your own...
But, to bring about a big change like altering the@school rules...

group_1.textRight: Like that teacher said,
you've got to have the title and power of a@"Student Council Prez"...Right?

group_1.textLeft: Indeed.
It's not just the hair color issue, either...@This school is quite lacking in freedom.
Don't you think they should value students'@autonomy more...?

group_1.textRight: Yeah... The school rules are too strict.
They've ironically caused some students to rebel@and become delinquents.

group_1.textLeft: So even though we are first-year students...
It might be a good idea to stand up and change@the school, right?
That being said, I'm not the kind of person who@can lead everyone...

group_1.textRight: That's not true, Kureha-san. I mean, it's all thanks@to you that we got to solve my hair color issue.
I'm sure you're the best girl for the job!
Then what're we even waiting for?@Let's go round up some supporters right away!

group_1.textLeft: Wha— Wait a minute!@What are you guys doing...?

group_1.textRight: You've totally got the power to lead us all, Kureha.
So, c'mon! Let's change this stuffy school together!
We'll root for you with all we have!

group_1.textLeft: (So that's what you meant, huh...)

group_1.narration: Normally, amidst a rough school climate, the@students all seem to go astray.@But that's because there are no signs of@improvement in the school.
If there is hope for change,@if there is someone who can lead that reform,@then surely this school can be changed...
